alert.note: Alert for Iron (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 12:19AM EDT until April 18 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Michigan... Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint) affecting Iron County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases has resulted in high water levels along the Paint River at Crystal Falls. As more snow melts, expecting minor to moderate flooding to be possible. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Paint River at Crystal Falls (Paint). * WHEN...From this evening to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Parking lot of roadside park upstream of M-69 begins to flood * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:10 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 6.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 8.5 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.1 feet on 05/08/1975. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/marquette. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 300 PM CDT.
